;战火纷飞的苏丹，脆弱的停火已经到位，可以为中国和西方合作稳定大非洲之角的机会。近年来，两个阵营之间的地缘政治紧张局势急剧升级，他们需要共同利益才能开始重新调整关系。

;

;有理由相信这种合作会取得丰硕成果，因为中国、美国和欧洲已经多年来，他们在亚丁湾联合打击海盗的斗争中取得了成功。动荡的东非地区是世界贸易的重要节点，位于通过马六甲海峡和台湾海峡连接欧洲与东亚的航运路线上。

;

;虽然俄罗斯入侵乌克兰的影响可能会影响北京和华盛顿之间的权力平衡，限制了中美合作的空间，“全球南方”的区域危机具有较软的地缘政治足迹，因此具有双赢互动的潜力。

;

;之后国际社会看好中国改善沙特与伊朗关系的努力及其推动通过谈判解决乌克兰冲突的努力，许多人现在希望北京能够继续其最近的外交热潮并介入苏丹危机。

;

;然而，目前情况并非如此。中国无意直接干预以安抚苏丹，至少在忠于苏丹实际统治者阿卜杜勒·法塔赫·布尔汉将军和准军事快速支援部队领导人穆罕默德·哈姆丹·达加洛将军的武装部队之间的争端仅限于苏丹领土之前。

;

;沙特阿拉伯和伊朗的战略和经济重要性影响了中国在它们之间进行调解的决定。北京在苏丹拥有长期的经济利益，但自 2011 年南苏丹成立以来该国分治以来，双边贸易和中国贷款稳步下降。

;

;中国更愿意让非洲联盟尝试解决苏丹的难题，就像去年所做的那样，努力导致签署和平协议以结束埃塞俄比亚的内战。然而，泛非集团和政府间发展管理局等区域行为体迄今未能采取任何具体的外交行动。

;

;相反，沙特阿拉伯和美国已介入争端并采取行动谈判中的主动权。他们的官员已与双方会面并在吉达进行调解，以确保交战各方之间的 7 天停火协议将于周日到期。

;

;中国的观望态度使其免于继续卷入冲突的代价像苏丹正在发生的棘手紧急情况。尽管北京最近采取了外交行动，但中国的做法仍然是“韬光养晦、蓄势待发”，这是已故最高领导人邓小平指导外交政策的方向。但是，这样做有可能让北京在该地区向华盛顿让出空间。

;

;就非洲的战略渗透而言，特别是通过“一带一路”倡议，中国在非洲的竞争力已经超过了美国和欧洲，习主席习近平旨在促进整个欧亚大陆及更远地区互联互通的计划。然而，在过去几年中，欧盟和美国总统拜登政府启动了经济和金融计划，以夺回在非洲大陆失去的地位。

;

;在此背景下，北京和西方必须分享防止苏丹武装对抗可能造成悲剧性后果的目标。大非洲之角已经不稳定，其特点是持续贫困、种族和宗教分歧以及相互冲突的历史主张。该地区也容易受到伊斯兰极端组织的渗透，例如伊斯兰国、基地组织及其当地分支机构。

;

;局势进一步恶化，加上另一边正在进行的也门内战Bab el-Mandeb 海峡，可能会危及世界贸易，因为欧洲的大部分海上贸易都要经过这个海上咽喉要道。值得注意的是，中国是 2022 年欧盟最大的进口来源国和欧盟第三大出口目的地，贸易总额超过 8500 亿欧元（9185 亿美元）。

;

;中西在苏丹问题上的外交协同作用将加强参与正在进行的讨论或任何未来会谈以结束战斗并为苏丹危机找到和平解决办法的美国和沙特调解人的合同权力。

;

;中国指责北约在亚洲有扩张计划。然而，值得记住的是，就在 2016 年，作为海洋盾牌行动的一部分，来自中国的军舰和跨大西洋联盟的成员还在亚丁湾进行了联合反海盗演习。

;

;此外，欧盟在阿拉伯海的反海盗部队经常称赞中国在打击索马里海域海盗方面的合作。两支海军特遣部队在该地区共同护送世界粮食计划署的人道主义车队，甚至共同训练以提高互操作性，包括在北京首个海外军事设施吉布提的中国支援基地进行联合演习。

;

;对于中国与西方关系中的所有问题，从贸易战和科技战到台湾、南中国海、俄罗斯入侵乌克兰和人权，南方国家不应该成为地缘政治影响力的战场。相反，它应该成为有利于世界稳定的负责任大国之间合作的场所。

;

;一位欧盟高级官员在布鲁塞尔再次敦促北京利用其对俄罗斯的影响力结束乌克兰战争。

;

;北京欧亚事务特使李辉会见了欧盟副秘书长恩里克莫拉，他正在领导中国的维和努力政治事务将军，星期四。会后，欧盟表示，莫拉强调“有必要尊重”乌克兰的主权。

;

;“欧盟期待中国……发挥建设性作用，并利用一切机会维护和促进联合国宪章和国际法，并回顾尊重主权、独立和领土完整原则的必要性，”欧盟声明说。

;

;这种期望包括北京努力让俄罗斯“停止流血和滥杀滥伤通过立即无条件地从国际公认边界内的乌克兰全境撤出所有部队和军事装备，以平民为目标”。

;

;该声明没有包含李的回应的任何细节，北京也没有立即发布其声明

;

;莫拉的评论与欧盟最高外交官何塞普·博雷尔本月早些时候的警告一致，即如果中国不做出努力，北京“不能指望与欧盟成为好朋友”结束俄罗斯对其邻国的攻击。<​​/p>;

;在他的欧洲之行中，李克强在这方面一直面临着一个信息，他从基辅开始与乌克兰总统弗拉基米尔·泽伦斯基和其他高级官员会面，包括外交部长德米特罗库列巴。

;

;泽伦斯基办公室在与李会面后发表了一份长篇声明，宣传其在 11 月提出的 10 点方案，该方案要求俄罗斯撤军并归还莫斯科占领的所有领土。

;

;在随后的李克强巡回访问中，类似的信息强调了博雷尔在斯德哥尔摩举行的欧盟 27 国外交部长就中国问题的辩论中所说的协调。 Borrell 在那里发出了警告，尽管一些部长并未完全接受阻挠俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔·普京的努力。

;

;欧盟最大的成员国法国和德国表示，欧洲对华政策不一定步调一致与华盛顿的关系，但在很大程度上支持要求北京对俄罗斯制服其邻国的努力采取更强硬立场的呼吁。

;

;博雷尔声称，欧盟 27 个成员国“在音乐背后团结一致”的立场文件中国由欧盟外交部撰写，并在内部对其内容进行激烈争论后在瑞典会议期间发送给成员国。

;

;波兰副外长 Wojciech Gerwel 上周五告诉李，乌克兰的和平只能通过以下方式实现俄罗斯撤军和归还“非法占领的领土”，以及对莫斯科的任何军事支持都会“对欧洲和中国的双边关系造成严重后果”。

;

;捷克外交部长呼吁更多欧盟和美国对中国采取统一的态度

;

;本周，捷克外交部长扬·利帕夫斯基在接受《南华早报》采访时表示，欧盟“必须与美国合作，远远超过[与]中国”。

;

;预计李克强将前往莫斯科与俄罗斯外交部长谢尔盖·拉夫罗夫会面。

;周四，一辆汽车与伦敦市中心的唐宁街大门相撞，英国首相的住所和办公室位于伦敦戒备最森严的地点之一，引发了快速的安全反应。

;

;大都会警察局表示，周四下午，一名男子因涉嫌犯罪在现场被捕损坏和危险驾驶。没有人员受伤的报告。

;

;当时总理 Rishi Sunak 在他的办公室里。

;

;社交媒体上发布的视频片段显示，一辆白色汽车低速直奔大门高速穿过伦敦政府区的主干道白厅。

;

;不久后拍摄的镜头显示，一辆汽车的后备箱打开，抵在高高的金属门上，警察正在检查这辆车。

;

; 目前尚不清楚坠机是否是故意的。警方表示，他们正在努力确定情况。

;

;“我听到一声巨响，然后抬头看到一大群警察拿着泰瑟枪对着那个人大喊大叫，”44 岁的目击者西蒙·帕里说。“很多警车来得很快，很快就撤离了该地区。”

;

;BBC 展示了一张警察带走一名双手被铐在背后的男子的照片。

;

;英国的苏纳克保持超速索赔后内政大臣的未来有多种选择

;

;事故发生后，官员们封锁了白厅，但在半小时内开始解除障碍，让人们回到白厅，那里通常挤满了公务员和热衷于此的游客参观附近的国会大厦和其他历史建筑。

;

;唐宁街是一条狭窄的街道，有一排格鲁吉亚风格的房屋，包括位于 10 号的首相官邸。

;

;公共通道通往街道的通道受到限制，大门始终由武装警察保护。

;

;大门建于 1989 年，以应对爱尔兰共和军激进分子的威胁。 1991 年，爱尔兰共和军向这条街发射了三枚迫击炮弹，其中一枚在 10 号大楼的后院爆炸，当时首相约翰·梅杰正在里面主持内阁会议。三名警察和一名公务员受轻伤。

;周四，伊朗当局在大批民众面前公开处决了一名男子，这是一项权利该组织表示，谴责伊斯兰共和国绞刑激增的“中世纪”做法。

;

;这名男子被判犯有“人间腐败”的死罪，在位于挪威的伊朗人权组织 (IHR) 表示，位于阿塞拜疆北部省份马拉盖市。

;

;“国际社会不能认可这种中世纪的做法”，IHR 主任 Mahmood Amiry-Moghaddam 说，并补充说处决显示了“政府试图通过对社会的残忍、羞辱和恐吓来延长其生命的真实面目”。

;

;伊朗新闻网站上发布的图片显示似乎有数百人聚集在检察官向记者发表讲话时，在安全录像带后面观看处决。

;

;伊朗称已处决了一个妇女贩卖网络的头目

;

;这名男子被蒙住眼睛，旁边是他的两个刽子手戴着头套。另一张照片显示，他在行刑前站在椅子上，脖子上套着套索，然后用一根绳子吊在空中，绳子系在一台死后的起重机上。死亡的时刻本身并没有显示。

;

;这名罪犯大约在五年前首次被捕，但没有透露姓名，他被判犯有与女性关系有关的指控，尽管所指控的具体性质罪行尚不清楚。

;

;根据国际特赦组织等人权组织的数据，伊朗每年处决的人比中国以外的任何国家都多，但公开处决相对罕见，几乎所有绞刑都在监狱内进行。

; p>;

;根据 IHR，2021 年没有公开处决。

;

;2022 年 7 月，伊恩在设拉子市公开绞死了一名被判谋杀警察的男子，12 月在马什哈德处决了穆赫森·拉纳瓦德 (Mohsen Rahnavard)，他参加了最近的反政府抗议浪潮，并因谋杀民兵特工而被定罪。

;

;但最近的处决特别不寻常，因为它发生在白天面对大量媒体存在的大量人群。 2022 年的两次公开处决似乎都是在黎明前进行的，几乎没有旁观者。

;

;伊朗在 1 月和 2 月处决了近 100 人：大赦

;

;伊朗目前处决人数激增2022 年 9 月，玛莎·阿米尼 (Mahsa Amini) 因涉嫌违反该国严格的着装规定而被捕后在拘留期间死亡，随后爆发了抗议浪潮，人权组织表示处决的目的是恐吓公众。

;

;七迄今为止，已有多名男子在与抗议相关的案件中被处以绞刑，而国际特赦组织本周警告称，另有 7 名与抗议有关的男子面临被处决的风险。

;

;根据《国际卫生条例》，今年已有 278 人被处决仅一年。

; Thu, 25 May 2023 23:50:02 +0800 China is supersizing its rocket industry – and it’s coming for Starlinkhttps://www.scmp.com/news/china/science/article/3221831/china-supersizing-its-rocket-industry-and-its-coming-starlink?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.05.25 23:00;
;;

;中国的火箭工业即将获得巨大的推动力。

;

;据参与该项目的科学家称，该国正在建造一座史无前例的火箭组装厂，每年可生产 50 枚长征八号火箭。

;

;一旦明年完工，这个位于热带岛屿海南岛的大型工厂将中国的年发射能力几乎翻了一番——已经是世界上最大的发射能力之一。

;

;根据公开信息，没有任何其他现有设施能够以这样的速度制造火箭。去年，Elon Musk 的 SpaceX 记录了 61 次发射，其中大部分使用可重复使用的猎鹰火箭。

;

;长征八号是一种低成本、不可重复使用的火箭，可以容纳 20 多颗 Starlink 大小的通信卫星.中国打算使用已经两次成功试射的中型运载火箭，每年将 1000 多颗卫星送入太空，与目前 SpaceX 的速度相当。

;

;但新火箭是还旨在将卫星置于比 Starlink 卫星更高的轨道上。更有利的高度将使中国卫星能够监视甚至压制他们的美国竞争对手。

;

;“建造巨型卫星星座的竞赛正在推动中国的航天工业进入一个新时代”，高级研究员宋正宇说领导长征 8 号团队的中国运载火箭技术研究院 (CALT) 的火箭科学家在上个月发表在《中国宇航学报》上的一篇论文中。

;

;

;

;为了赶上 SpaceX 的星链计划，除了目前在轨的 4,000 多颗卫星之外，中国还计划发射近 13,000 颗卫星。

;

;该项目代号为“GW”-据一些解放军科学家称，它专门用于在发生战争时压制 Starlink 的全球服务。

;

;但宋及其同事表示，中国目前的火箭阵容无法胜任这项任务。他们说，现有的长征火箭要么太小，要么太大。

;

;长征八号旨在填补这一空白，效率空前。

;

;它“可以满足超过中国90%的后续发射任务要求是中低轨”，宋说。

;

;同时，中国现有的火箭生产方式无法达到GW项目要求的速度，根据火箭科学家的说法。

;

;传统的火箭生产涉及工人组装不同的部件，然后将它们连接到火箭的固定位置。火箭本身并不沿着生产线移动，而是停留在一个地方，而工人们则绕着它移动以完成他们的任务。

;

;一些现代火箭制造商已经开始采用脉冲装配线技术——类似于过去使用的技术在战斗机生产中 – 以加快装配速度并降低成本。

;

;SpaceX 开发了一种称为“猎鹰 9 号集成装配线”的自动化系统，该系统使用同步脉冲在装配过程中快速高效地移动火箭部件.与传统方法相比，该方法使 SpaceX 能够以更低的成本生产更多的火箭。

;

;海南文昌的长征 8 号工厂将与 SpaceX 的工厂类似，但也将具有一些独特的优势，据称宋的团队。

;

;中国公布了月球研究站的建设路线图

;

;要使脉冲装配线有效，它必须稳定供应高质量的部件，以便快速

;

;在中国，这样的任务相对容易以具有竞争力的成本实现，因为该国拥有世界上最大的许多工业产品制造能力，包括那些需要高学历的产品

;

;

;

;使用现有的长征火箭将 1 千克（2.2 磅）货物送入近地轨道 (LEO) 的成本约为 3,000 美元，类似于中国最大的火箭制造商中国航天科技集团公司的研究人员最近发布的一份报告显示，SpaceX 的可重复使用的猎鹰 9 号火箭的成本。

;

;Song 的团队表示，他们已经找到了进一步降低成本的方法长征八号，其中一些以前从未尝试过。

;

;模态测试是一个艰苦的过程，它测量结构的自然频率和振型，可以帮助工程师了解结构在不同载荷下的行为和条件。历史上，未进行模态试验的火箭都经历过重大失败。

;

;长征八号火箭是世界上第一枚无需全尺寸模态试验就成功飞行的火箭。相反，科学家们使用模拟来获得允许成功发射的动态参数，即使在取消助推器和更换整流罩之后也是如此。

;

;通过使用最新的数字设计和模拟工具，“开发周期缩短了 12 个月，该团队在论文中称，“节省了大量试验资金”。优化火箭的轨迹。

;

;具体而言，在第二阶段飞行的第一部分，火箭沿着亚轨道路径滑向特定目标。然后，在第二阶段的第二部分，它切换到动力飞行以到达其最终目标轨道。

;

;该方法可以更精确地控制火箭的轨迹，并可以帮助它适应偏离其目标轨道的情况预期的路径。这很难实现，因为它需要火箭飞行不同阶段之间的精确计时和协调。

;

;为了进一步降低成本，长征八号不再需要三重冗余惯性测量单元 (IMU) 配置。相反，它使用简化的双 IMU 配置。这需要新技术来提高飞行的可靠性和智能性，并使用替代方法来解决潜在的故障。

;

;目前，SSO 主要用于地球观测卫星。之所以称为“太阳同步”，是因为卫星每天在同一本地时间经过地球上的任何给定点，这使得对温度、植被生长和洋流等事物进行一致的测量变得更加容易。

;< p>;SSO 与大多数 Starlink 卫星使用的 LEO 相比，既有优点也有缺点。一个优点是它允许更一致和准确的数据收集，因为卫星在一天的同一时间经过同一区域。

;

;因为它们在更高的地方，SSO 卫星也更容易与之通信因为它们与地面站的视线更清晰。

;

;不过，SSO 也有缺点。进入这种类型的轨道需要更多的能量，而且由于 SSO 中的卫星比 LEO 中的卫星离地球更远，因此它们的响应速度较慢，传输数据的速度也较慢。

; Thu, 25 May 2023 22:50:02 +0800 Taiwan weighs options for ageing fleet of Mirage 2000 fighter jetshttps://www.scmp.com/news/china/military/article/3221813/taiwan-weighs-options-ageing-fleet-mirage-2000-fighter-jets?utm_source=rss_feed

;As the People's Liberation Army deploys ever more advanced warplanes, Taiwan's air force is considering the options for its ageing fleet of Mirage 2000s.

;

;The island bought 60 of the fighter jets from France back in 1992, amid strong protests from Beijing.

;

;Built by Dassault Aviation, the aircraft entered service in 1997. To keep them in service they will need a system upgrade, but Dassault no longer produces this type of jet and is reportedly asking for an eye-watering sum to do the update.

;

;Taiwanese Defence Minister Chiu Kuo-cheng was grilled by lawmakers on Thursday about whether the Mirage fleet would be retired or upgraded, as the PLA rapidly expands its fleet of more advanced and powerful fighter jets.

;

;Chiu told the legislative meeting that the Mirage fleet still performed well but “over time” there would be an issue with the ageing fighter jets, which are based in Hsinchu, in the island's north.

;

;“Of course, there is an age concern for the jets and we will make certain plans about this,” he said.

;

;Pressed on whether the Mirage fleet would be retired or sold, Chiu said: “The air force is making an assessment on whether to replace or upgrade them. All these would be options – the air force is still studying which one to choose.”

;

;Taiwan's ban on Chinese tourists set to ease in 'huge' lift after 3-year hiatus

;

;The Mirage 2000s were Taiwan's most powerful warplanes in the 1990s and the mainstay of the air force. Fifty-four of the aircraft are still in operation after six were damaged in crashes, and Taiwan has a maintenance service agreement with France that expires in 2026.

;

;The island has asked Dassault to update the fighter jets several times, but – allegedly under pressure from Beijing – the French company is said to have demanded a high price for the upgrade.

;

;When Taiwan bought the Mirage fleet, it also ordered 460 Magic missiles and 960 Mica missiles. It has allocated US$16.7 million for the island's top weapons maker, the National Chung-Shan Institute of Science and Technology, to extend the life of these short-range air-to-air missiles.

;

;Taiwan is also modernising other fighter jets.在美国国防承包商洛克希德马丁公司的帮助下，其 141 架 F-16A/B 战隼战斗机机队正在升级为 F-16 毒蛇战斗机。该升级预计将于今年年底完成。 And 130 of its Indigenous Defence Fighters were upgraded in 2018, also with US help.

;

;In 2019 – after the island's request for F-35s was rejected by Washington – Taiwan ordered 66 F-16 Block 70s from the US. The first two were due for delivery in the third quarter of this year.

;

;However, Chiu on Thursday said the first delivery had been postponed to the fourth quarter of next year because of flight control software problems. He said the full delivery was still on track to meet the original schedule of 2026.

;

;“In principle, by 2026 the 66 aircraft will all have arrived – there is absolutely no problem with this,” he said.

;

;Taiwan has been under constant military pressure from Beijing, which views the island as part of its territory to be taken under control – by force if necessary. Most countries, including the US, do not see Taiwan as an independent state but are opposed to a change of the status quo by force.

;The United Kingdom's foreign minister revealed on Thursday that he had raised the case of jailed media tycoon Jimmy Lai Chee-ying, who holds a British passport and faces collusion charges in Hong Kong, with China's vice-president earlier this month.

;

;Foreign Secretary James Cleverly reiterated his accusation that city authorities had used the Beijing-decreed national security legislation and the sedition law to “target prominent pro-democracy figures, journalists and politicians in an effort to silence and discredit them” in Britain's latest six-monthly parliamentary report on Hong Kong.

;

;“Detained British dual national Jimmy Lai is one such figure. I raised his case with Chinese Vice-President Han Zheng earlier this month, and we have raised it at the highest levels with the Hong Kong authorities,” Cleverly said.

;

;He added Lai, founder of the now-defunct Apple Daily newspaper, along with 47 opposition activists charged for subversion over an unofficial primary, among others, would be put on trial under the security law this year.

;

;“Many of these individuals have been held on remand without bail for over two years. Thousands who were arrested during the protests in 2019 are still waiting to learn if they will face trial,” he said.

;

;Cleverly was urged by several groups, including the London-based Hong Kong Watch, to directly raise Lai's case with Han during the vice-president's visit to London to attend King Charles' coronation earlier this month.

;Hong Kong court upholds decision to bar British lawyer from Jimmy Lai trial

;Lai is set to stand trial in September without a jury on charges of sedition and conspiracy to collude with foreign forces. ;

;Cleverly said China remained in “an ongoing state of non-compliance” with the Sino-British Joint Declaration in the latest report, referring to the deal signed in 1984 between London and Beijing which set out the terms of the city's 1997 return to Chinese rule.

;

;“We have stood with our partners in condemning the steady erosion of civil and political rights and Hong Kong's autonomy. China should uphold all its international commitments, including the Joint Declaration,” he said.

;

;Much of the report was dedicated to the arrest and jailing of opposition members, ongoing national security cases and the increasing use of the colonial-era sedition law, which it said had led to the arrest or conviction of activists, civil servants and ordinary citizens, mostly for non-violent free speech.

;

;“Acts such as criticising judges during court hearings and publishing anti-government content online overseas were ruled seditious. High profile pro-democracy figures, including Jimmy Lai and former pan-democratic politicians, were jailed for non-[national security law] offences,” it said.

;

;“Freedom of the press came under increasing pressure.对记者的起诉仍在继续。 A number of them remained in custody awaiting sentence or facing trial.”

;

;The report claimed that the national security legislation and the sedition law continued to damage the city's way of life, adding that the British government would “lead efforts to scrutinise the Chinese government's actions” alongside its international partners.

;

;Although the report covered the period between July and December last year, Cleverly noted the recent proposed changes to the city's district councils, which would drastically slash the number of directly elected seats. ;

;Lawyers for Hong Kong's Jimmy Lai say tycoon denied fair trial, subject to persecution

;

;“Powers once vested in the judiciary have transferred to the chief executive. Those facing national security charges no longer have the right to challenge government decisions in the courts,” he wrote.

;

;Last month, Cleverly laid down London's multifaceted approach to China by seeking a constructive relationship while engaging with Beijing on its “authoritarianism” where necessary.

;

;Meanwhile, the latest data showed that 9,411 Hongkongers applied for the British National (Overseas) visa scheme, London's bespoke migration pathway, between January and March this year. The scheme was introduced on January 31, 2021, in the wake of the imposition of the national security law in Hong Kong.

;

;A total of 8,222 people were granted the visa from October to December last year.

;

;As of March, up to 172,500 applications had been logged since the BN(O) visa scheme's introduction.

;It would be Wang's first face-to-face meeting with Raimondo since the latter took office in 2021. Wang last met Tai in Thailand in November at another Apec meeting.

;The meetings will be another attempt by the world's top two economies to re-engage after repeated stalemates as bilateral ties soured in recent years.

;

;But the momentum was halted when an alleged Chinese spy balloon floated into US airspace in February.美国国务卿安东尼·布林肯因此取消了原定的访华计划。 Raimondo's trip to China in March was also postponed.

;“[Wang's meetings with Tai and Raimondo] are good first steps, but they will not change the downward trajectory of bilateral relations,” said David M. Lampton, former president of the National Committee on US-China Relations and professor emeritus at Johns Hopkins SAIS, now at the SAIS Foreign Policy Institute.

;The latest volley came as Beijing banned Micron Technology, the largest US memory chip maker, from selling its products to critical information infrastructure operators in China, citing “severe national security risk”.

;

;“The relevant cybersecurity review is a necessary measure to safeguard China's national security,” Shu said of the ban at a press conference on Thursday.

;Lampton said the sanction on Micron was incompatible with improving investment and commercial relations, and fed the Western impulse to “de-risk” from China.

;The electronic system will allow drivers to pay the flat rate of HK$8 (US$1) without having to stop at toll booths or queue up.

;

;The new payment method will go live at 5am on Sunday and there will be some permanent lane closures as a result.

;

;The seven lanes to the Kowloon Tong side of the tunnel will be cut to three.沙田入口的车道数目将从六条减半为三条。 Toll booths will close for good.

;

;The entire tunnel will be closed from 4.30am to 5am.

;

;Some bus routes will be affected – the N170, N182, N271, N281, and N373, as well as six overnight New Territories green minibus routes, including 61S, 63S, 65S, 501S, 616S, and 805S.

;

;Lanes to Kowloon Tong will be closed in stages from 10pm on Saturday and those at Sha Tin will be closed from 1am on Sunday.

;

;

;But at least one lane and three toll booths will remain open in both directions at any one time until 4.30am.

;

;The Transport Department said 90,000 vehicles pass through the Lion Rock Tunnel, which links Kowloon Tong and Sha Tin, every day.

;

;About 60,000 vehicles use the Tsing-Sha control area each day and 50,000 vehicles travel through the Shing Mun Tunnel a day.

;

;Chief Traffic Engineer (New Territories East) Albert Ho Kwan-hang said the department had issued about 740,000 tags for the e-toll system, which account for more than 91 per cent of the licensed vehicles in the city.

;

;About 80 per cent of tag holders have opened an HKeToll account and 70 per cent of them have already set up automatic payment methods.

;

;Ho added that there were around 10 complaints a day about incorrect charges made to the department after the system was introduced at the two earlier crossings.

;

;

;Law highlighted that 5 per cent of vehicles using the Shing Mun Tunnel did not carry a tag. She said the figure for the Tsing-Sha control area was higher, but still in the single digits.

;

;HKeToll requires road users to apply for a tag, which is scanned at the tunnel for fares, open a special account online and create a payment method.

;

;Vehicle owners who have set up HKeToll account with a payment method will get a successful transaction notification when they go through the tunnel.

;

;Drivers without the HKeToll tag or who have yet to set up a payment method will get an electronic payment notice and are required to settle the account inside 14 business days or face a surcharge of HK$175, raised to HK$350 after 21 days.

;

;Motorists will face legal action if they refuse to pay.
